body_html:
@facaiy Thank you for the reply!

Yes, this is about a feature. I am working on a model seems like:

In fact, the model is more complex than that due to the model is used to simulate game operation. Classification is responsible for decide whether it is good time for action. Then the regression will give the details about the action. It contains a combination of CNN and RNN.

So that, when I'm training the model, I have to let model know whether I am training the classification or regression since I had a proper loss function. I'm wondering if we can feed feature with dict, why we can not feed labels with dict as well.

body:
@facaiy Thank you for the reply!

Yes, this is about a feature. I am working on a model seems like: 
![this](https://i.stack.imgur.com/gxxo0.png)

In fact, the model is more complex than that due to the model is used to simulate game operation. Classification is responsible for decide whether it is good time for action. Then the regression will give the details about the action. It contains a combination of CNN and RNN.

So that, when I'm training the model, I have to let model know whether I am training the classification or regression since I had a proper loss function. I'm wondering if we can feed feature with dict, why we can not feed labels with dict as well.
